wikipedia_page.main: William Speechly (1735 – 1 October 1819) was a late 18th- and early 19th-century English horticulturist, best known as the head gardener to William Henry Cavendish-Bentinck, 3rd Duke of Portland, and for his skill in growing pineapples and grapes.

response: * William Speechly horticulturalist and early cultivator of pineapples and grapes in the UK.
